ai-ud6.4:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud6.4:1.3_0: Now at that time several ascetics and brahmins who follow various other paths were residing in Sāvatthī.
ai-ud6.4:2.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:2.2_0: “The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.”
ai-ud6.4:3.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:4.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:5.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:6.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:6.2_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing.”
ai-ud6.4:7.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:7.2_0: “The soul and the body are different things.”
ai-ud6.4:8.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:9.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:9.2_0: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death.”
ai-ud6.4:10.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:10.2_0: “A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death.”
ai-ud6.4:11.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:11.2_0: “A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.”
ai-ud6.4:12.1_0: They were arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words. They think:
ai-ud6.4:12.2_0: “Such is Truth, such is not Truth!
ai-ud6.4:12.3_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.4:13.1_0: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ai-ud6.4:13.2_0: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha,
ai-ud6.4:13.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud6.4:14.1_0: “Sir, there are several ascetics and brahmins who follow various other paths—
ai-ud6.4:15.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.4:15.2_0: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’ ...
ai-ud6.4:15.3_0: They were arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words. They think:
ai-ud6.4:15.5_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.4:16.1_0: “The wanderers who follow other paths are blind and sightless.
ai-ud6.4:16.2_0: They don't understand what is beneficial or what is not beneficial, nor what is the truth and what is not the truth.
ai-ud6.4:16.3_0: That’s why they are arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words.
ai-ud6.4:16.5_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’
ai-ud6.4:17.1_0: Once upon a time, mendicants, right here in Sāvatthī there was a certain king.
ai-ud6.4:17.2_0: Then the king addressed a man,
ai-ud6.4:17.3_0: ‘Please, mister, gather all those blind from birth throughout Sāvatthī and bring them together in one place.’
ai-ud6.4:17.4_0: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ that man replied. He did as the king asked, then said to him,
ai-ud6.4:17.4_1: He went to the king and said to him:
ai-ud6.4:17.5_0: ‘Your Majesty, the blind people throughout Sāvatthī have been gathered.’
ai-ud6.4:17.6_0: ‘Well then, my man, show them an elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:17.7_0: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ that man replied. He did as the king asked.
ai-ud6.4:18.1_0: To some of the blind people he showed the elephant’s head, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.2_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.3_0: To some of them he showed the elephant’s ear, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.4_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.5_0: To some of them he showed the elephant’s tusk, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.6_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.7_0: To some of them he showed the elephant’s trunk, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.8_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.9_0: To some of them he showed the elephant’s flank, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.10_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.11_0: To some of them he showed the elephant’s leg, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.12_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.13_0: To some of them he showed the elephant’s thigh, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.14_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.15_0: To some of them he showed the elephant’s tail, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.16_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:18.17_0: To some of them he showed the tip of the elephant’s tail, saying,
ai-ud6.4:18.18_0: ‘An elephant has been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:19.1_0: Then he approached the king and showed it to him.
ai-ud6.4:19.1_1: He went to the king and said to him:
ai-ud6.4:19.2_0: ‘Your Majesty, the blind people have been shown the elephant.
ai-ud6.4:19.3_0: Please do whatever you think is appropriate.’
ai-ud6.4:20.1_0: Then the king went up to the blind people and said,
ai-ud6.4:20.3_0: ‘Yes, Your Majesty, we have been shown the elephant.’
ai-ud6.4:20.4_0: ‘Then tell us, what kind of thing is an elephant?’
ai-ud6.4:21.1_0: The blind people who had been shown the elephant’s head said,
ai-ud6.4:21.2_0: ‘Your Majesty, an elephant is like a pot.’
ai-ud6.4:22.1_0: Those who had been shown the ear said,
ai-ud6.4:23.1_0: Those who had been shown the tusk said,
ai-ud6.4:24.1_0: Those who had been shown the trunk said,
ai-ud6.4:25.1_0: Those who had been shown the flank said,
ai-ud6.4:26.1_0: Those who had been shown the leg said,
ai-ud6.4:27.1_0: Those who had been shown the thigh said,
ai-ud6.4:28.1_0: Those who had been shown the tail said,
ai-ud6.4:29.1_0: Those who had been shown the tip of the tail said,
ai-ud6.4:30.1_0: Saying, ‘Such is an elephant, not such!
ai-ud6.4:30.2_0: Such is not an elephant, such is!’ they punched each other with their fists.
ai-ud6.4:30.3_0: At that, the king was pleased.
ai-ud6.4:31.1_0: In the same way, mendicants, the wanderers who follow other paths are blind and sightless.
ai-ud6.4:31.2_0: They don't understand what is beneficial or what is not beneficial, nor what is the truth and what is not the truth.
ai-ud6.4:31.3_0: That’s why they are arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words.
ai-ud6.4:31.5_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.4:32.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud6.4:33.4_0: the folk who see just one part.”
